data.name: Decimal to Fraction
data.description:
Write a function that converts a given decimal number into a fraction.

The decimal number is given as a string, and may have recurring digits, which appear in parentheses.
The output fraction must be reduced as much as possible.

Examples:
```java
decimalToFraction("0.(3)") => "1/3"
decimalToFraction("10.25") => "41/4"
decimalToFraction("-4.2") => "-21/5"
decimalToFraction("5") => "5/1"
```
```rust
decimal_to_fraction("0.(3)") => "1/3"
decimal_to_fraction("10.25") => "41/4"
decimal_to_fraction("-4.2") => "-21/5"
decimal_to_fraction("5") => "5/1"
```
```python
decimal_to_fraction("0.(3)") => "1/3"
decimal_to_fraction("10.25") => "41/4"
decimal_to_fraction("-4.2") => "-21/5"
decimal_to_fraction("5") => "5/1"
```

The input string will contain at most 18 digits, and conform to the following regular expressions:
```
non-recurring: -?[0-9]+(\.[0-9]+)?
recurring:     -?[0-9]+\.[0-9]*\([0-9]+\)
```
